_header: Ego principium Alpha et O in altissimis habito / In thee…
_description: The Norwich Play of the Creation of Eve — seventy-eight lines in rhyme royal

NorfRO21f.First Lines:
Ego principium Alpha & oo in altissimis habitoIn þe
                    hevenly Empery I am resydentYt ys not semely for man sine
                    adjutorio…
NorfRO21f.Last Lines:
…together lett us synge & lett our hartes reioyse&
                    gloryfye owr God wyth mynde powre & voyse
NorfRO21f.Note:
Eighteenth-century transcript of the lost Grocers’ Book; after
                    Adam and Eve (i.e., on f. 2) the note, ‘nb these last 2 lines set to
                    musick twice over and again for a chorus of 4 pts’ (f. 2)
NorfRO21f.Attributed Title:
Grocers Book (f. 1); The Story of þe creacion of Eve & þe
                    expellyng of Adam & Eve out of Paradyce (f. 1); The Storye of þe
                    Temptacion of man in Paradyce being therin placyd & þe expellynge of
                    man & woman from thence newely renvid & accordynge vnto þe
                    Skripture begon this yere 1565 Anno 7 Eliz (f. 3)
